meanings.definition: A structure built at the front of a ship to divide the water and reduce resistance.
meanings.sent1: The cutwaters on the ship helped it move smoothly through the waves.
meanings.sent2: The ship's cutwaters were designed to make it more aerodynamic in the water.
meanings.sent3: The cutwaters on the boat looked like sharp fins ready to slice through the sea.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was the cutwaters that guided her through life's challenges.
meanings.sent5: The cutwaters of the vessel sliced through the water effortlessly.

meanings.definition: A projecting point of land or rock.
meanings.sent1: The rugged cutwaters jutted out into the ocean, creating a picturesque view.
meanings.sent2: We climbed to the top of the cutwaters to get a better view of the coastline.
meanings.sent3: The cutwaters of the cliff provided a perfect spot for birdwatching.
meanings.sent4: The cutwaters of the rocky outcrop stood like guardians against the crashing waves.
meanings.sent5: The shipwreck lay hidden behind the imposing cutwaters of the headland.
